messages.subject: Re: (Always Learning) ideas for group activities for older kids
messages.msgSnippet: ===Don t know if this has been mentioned but Shrinky Dinks are so fun. I  have the Klutz kit book and then just buy the extra Shrinky Dink paper in bulk
messages.messageBody:
===Don't know if this has been mentioned but Shrinky Dinks are so fun.
I have the Klutz kit book and then just buy the extra Shrinky Dink
paper in bulk online. Have lots of Multi-colored Sharpies on hand,
hole punch, jewelry making supplies for necklaces and earrings and an
oven. ===

This made me remember fuse beads. You put the little cylindrical beads
on the plastic pegged shapes and then you iron them and they fuse
together. These are always a hit with the kids that visit our house.
I guess most parents are afraid of the tiny beads getting scattered
(which they sometimes do).

Tina

messages.subject: Re: [SPAM][AlwaysLearning] Re: (Always Learning) ideas for group activities for older kids
messages.msgSnippet: oh yes - thanks so much for teh reminder about shrinky dinks!  i LOVED those as a kid.  another thing that s fun is the design your own plates and bowls - you
messages.messageBody:
oh yes - thanks so much for teh reminder about shrinky dinks! i LOVED those as a kid. another thing that's fun is the design your own plates and bowls - you order this special paper (circles) and the kids draw on it and then you send them in and the come back as plastic bowls or plates - like bakelite - is that the material?

----- Original Message -----
From: gailbrocop@...
To: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, September 12, 2008 2:11 PM
Subject: [SPAM][AlwaysLearning] Re: (Always Learning) ideas for group activities for older kids


Don't know if this has been mentioned but Shrinky Dinks are so fun. I have
the Klutz kit book and then just buy the extra Shrinky Dink paper in bulk
online. Have lots of Multi-colored Sharpies on hand, hole punch, jewelry
making supplies for necklaces and earrings and an oven.


Gail

_http://gail-hummingbirdhaven.blogspot.com/_
(http://gail-hummingbirdhaven.blogspot.com/)
